alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 3:21PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Blaine, Chouteau and Hill. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM MDT, Saturday, reports of minor flooding in the advisory area continue to be received, especially in low- lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Havre, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Agency, Azure, Sangrey, St. Pierre, Boneau, Box Elder, Fort Belknap, Gildford, Hays, Inverness, Turner, Hingham, Lohman and Lloyd. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
